intro: Ruschia sobrina, commonly known as the flame flower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant, showy flowers that range from red to orange in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Ruschia sobrina is also valued for its drought tolerance and ability to bloom throughout the growing season.
